page.title: 11The Llandaff Rowing Club.
page.content: The Llandaff Rowing Club on the banks of the river Taff was founded in 1879 and is the oldest in Wales. There are 400 members but only 60 are active rowers. The boat-builder and organiser of the club, which shares facilities with the University College of Wales, Cardiff, is Mr John Essex. He is the third generation of his family to have worked there. The rowers use 0.75 mile stretch of the Taff. The water is far cleaner now than it was 10 yrs ago, and has some fish and eels in spite of polution. The highest cost for a boat is between Â£6,000 and Â£7,000 and the oars cost Â£1,200. The club also has a bar, shower room, and a weight room. There is an annual regatta in July.
